timeline.message: Add functions on HHCode from GeoXPLib
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:senx/warp10-platform into geoxplib
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:senx/warp10-platform into geoxplib
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:senx/warp10-platform into geoxplib
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:senx/warp10-platform into geoxplib

timeline.bodyText: This should not be a field, it should be a local variable updated for each invocation of the function
timeline.author: hbs

timeline.bodyText: Don't reference the stack, and in the present case this would be only 2 elements.
timeline.author: hbs
hbs

timeline.bodyText: Same goes for res, make it a local variable
timeline.author: hbs

timeline.bodyText: drop reference of isLongFormat, simply return a long and in apply convert to string at the given resolution if the input was a string
timeline.author: hbs

timeline.bodyText: Actually since you accept either LONG, STRING or BYTES as input it would be more logical to output a byte array if the input was a byte array. So instead of passing isLongFormat, why not simply pass the input and check its type in manageFormat?
timeline.author: hbs

timeline.message: Manage output as a byte array
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:senx/warp10-platform into geoxplib

timeline.bodyText: Actually for a HHCode resolution can be up to 32, it is only for cells in a GeoXPShape that resolution is limited to 30.
timeline.author: hbs
